CMPT.introduction: Computing Science at SFU requires a blend of theoretical understanding and practical coding skills. Success comes from starting assignments early and mastering the fundamentals.

strategies.title: Start Assignments Early
strategies.description: CMPT assignments often have hidden edge cases. Starting day one allows time for debugging.

strategies.title: Master the Debugger
strategies.description: Don't rely on print statements. Learning GDB or VS Code debugger saves hours.

strategies.title: Lab Attendance
strategies.description: Labs are often worth small marks but they are the best place to ask TAs clarifying questions.

BUS.introduction: Beedie School of Business courses focus on application, group work, and case analysis. Networking and participation are key.

strategies.title: Participate in Class
strategies.description: Participation marks can be up to 20%. Speak up at least once per lecture.

strategies.title: Network
strategies.description: Your peers are your future connections. Join business clubs like BASS or SFU JDC West.

videos.title: How to Analyze a Case Study

MATH.introduction: Mathematics requires consistent practice. Don't fall behind, as concepts build on each other sequentially.

strategies.title: Do the Practice Problems
strategies.description: Reading the textbook isn't enough. You must solve problems without looking at the solution.

strategies.title: Visit the Workshop
strategies.description: The Math Workshop in the library is free tutoring. Use it.

DEFAULT.introduction: Success in this course is about time management and utilizing available resources effectively.

strategies.title: Read the Syllabus
strategies.description: It contains the schedule, grading scheme, and policy. It is your roadmap.

strategies.title: Office Hours
strategies.description: Professors are waiting for students to visit. It's the best way to get personalized help.
